name: The Crescent

reviews.text: having just stayed there we found everything to be of the very best. the bed most comfortable, the room immaculately clean, likewise the bathroom ensuite. the breakfast was superb with a very good and wide choice.
reviews.title: cannot be beaten
A great place to stay!
reviews.text: the owners Andy and Dena are warm, friendly,helpfull without being obtrusive.whatever is required is done willingly and with a smile. clearly they have both put in a lot of time and planning putting the whole package together,even to take care of those items so easily left at home, toothbrush, paste, razor etc

I stayed at the Crescent for one night before a wedding and was extremely impressed by the service and the building. The owners are the friendliest I've met in any hotel, the room was immaculate, and the breakfast (cooked to order) was excellent. I had to stay the following night in another (more expensive) hotel, and wished I was back at The Cresent!
reviews.title: very satisfactory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Recommended for a stay in Swansea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and tidy room, nice breakfast, free wi-fi connection, easy street parking outside, close to restaurants, pleasant and helpful hosts, lovely period house………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………
reviews.title: Very clean, comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: I could write so much but it would take me months.....
reviews.title: perfect in every possible way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The perfect couple.....warm, friendly, helpful, down to earth.....made time for you, chatted to you with a smile....
reviews.title: Good base for the Swansea area

reviews.text: The perfect food.......made with love, cooked to perfection, exactly was you want it, loads of choice.
reviews.title: Weekend in Swansea staying at Crescent B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room.....amazing, spotless, lovely little touches, sensational bed, clean tidy and care made when laying out.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at The Crescent, Swansea

reviews.text: The location....perfect, free parking on the road, quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we received a very warm welcome from Andy and Dina. Our room was very spacious and spotlessly clean. We had an excellent night's sleep. Andy told us about various eateries in the area and we walked to a very nice restaurant for dinner. Breakfast was very good and our hosts really do give their guests excellent service. We would definitely recommend The Crescent to anyone wanting to visit this area of Wales. It is convenient and very good value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Andy and Dina were as ever very helpful and welcoming. I've tried some of the local competition, but keep on returning here as apart from the welcome, all the rooms are not on the same floor as the front door, on street parking is easy to find (not obvious in this part of Swansea) and the view over the bay from most of the bedrooms is stunning.
reviews.title: Friendly comfortable guest house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and comfortable with ensuite shower room - traditional decor throughout - included fluffy towels, small TV, tea/coffee making facilities and hairdryer. The full English breakfast was perfectly cooked. Free WiFi and on road parking. We had no complaints and good for a one night stay when passing through the area.
reviews.title: Good for a one night stay

reviews.text: I booked this delightful accomodaton for just one night, had a delightful, spotless room and such a warm and helpful welcome. They gave us advice on where to find our destinations and were very impressed by Dena and Andy, who quickly seemed like old friends.
reviews.title: Very pleased we stayed here

reviews.text: The room was spacious and comfortable and it was so quiet in this delightful area.
reviews.title: home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For my first ever stay in a B&B this was first class. Spent one night in this really cosy bed and breakfast with my boyfriend and we were met by Andy and Dena, who were friendly and genuine. They were very happy to help, recommending a good restaurant down the road and places to go for a drink. Our room was large and the bed was massive and comfortable. Overall I would highly recommend this B&B.
reviews.title: Just like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With no expectations prior to arriving, I found this marvellous little B and B to be just what I needed when so far away from home. The welcome and attention is first class and the friendliness made a huge difference to my brief stay. I have certainly found a base for future visits to Swansea.
reviews.title: Just like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed in quite a few B&Bs and hotels in Swansea over the last ten years and this is definitely the best. It's in a quiet location within walking distance of the marina and the town. The rooms are spotless, the beds very comfortable, and it's so nice to have proper branded toiletries! The cooked breakfasts are delicious. Andy and Dena are chatty and helpful without being intrusive and we wouldn't hesitate in recommending this B&B.
reviews.title: A really excellent B&B

reviews.text: I arrived late at night in the pouring rain. Got in eventually and was offered a *free* upgrade to a suite instead of the room I'd booked because the hotel wasn't that busy. Excellent. Also, Dena offered to carry my suitcase upstairs, even though I am 6" 4' and broad with it and she's only quite middling in height and build. I declined, of course, but again: excellent service. The suite was uber big and really clean. Excellent. But then: Dena says, "If you bring in food, you must eat downstairs in the dining room".
reviews.title: I know how to eat in!

reviews.text: Er what?
reviews.title: Best b&b in swansea

description: Our Edwardian Town House is situated in a quiet, leafy crescent standing in an elevated position overlooking Swansea bay. This position provides panoramic views of the city and the bay. The city centre and popular Grand theatre are 15 minutes walk away, Brangwyn Hall is just 5 minutes walk, and Swansea University, Wales National Pool and Singleton Hospital are all approximately a 25 minute walk. The Uplands area is well served by public transport.
